brief_summary.textblock:
Evaluation of the impact of bystander CPR, prehospital resuscitation protocols, and hospital
      post-resuscitation protocols for out-of-hospital cardiac arrest patients in the state of
      Arizona.

clinical_study.brief_title: Save Hearts in Arizona Registry and Education (SHARE) Project

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest (loss of spontaneous circulation and EMS attempted
             resuscitation)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Do Not Resuscitate

study_pop.textblock:
Out-of-hospital cardiac arrest patients on which resuscitation was attempted by Emergency
        Medical Services in the state of Arizona

other_outcome.description: The average 9-1-1 call is expected to be approximately 8 minutes.
other_outcome.measure: Frequency and Quality of Telephone Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)

other_outcome.description: Type of bystander Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) given, if any. The average length of time between cardiac arrest and EMS arrival is expected to be approximately 10 minutes.
other_outcome.measure: Proportion of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest patients receiving bystander Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)
other_outcome.time_frame: Time of cardiac arrest to EMS arrival

other_outcome.description: The average patient encounter timeframe is expected to be approximately 15 minutes.
other_outcome.measure: Proportion of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest patients transported to a recognized Cardiac Receiving Center

other_outcome.description: The average time from hospital admission to either discharge or death is expected to be approximately 2 weeks.
other_outcome.measure: Proportion of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest patients receiving Guideline post-arrest care

other_outcome.description: Post arrest care measures include therapeutic hypothermia and percutaneous coronary intervention. Patients will be followed for the duration of their hospital stay. The average time from hospital admission to either discharge or death is expected to be approximately 2 weeks.

primary_outcome.description: Patients will be followed for the duration of hospital stay. The average time from admission to either discharge or death is expected to be approximately 2 weeks.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon hospital discharge and annually up to 5 years

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Chest compression depth, rate, recoil, fraction. Patients will be followed for the duration of prehospital resuscitation. The average timeframe is expected to be approximately 15 minutes.
secondary_outcome.measure: Emergency Medical Services Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) quality

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
